sense.name: A circular segment of a curve.
sense.examples: There's a sharp turn in the road ahead. There have been many turns in the path of my life.

sense.name: The act of changing course or twisting oneself.
sense.examples: He took a turn to the right. With a turn of his head, he surveyed the room. He made a turn away from her.

sense.name: (game) a division during which one is allowed to play (perhaps as offense).
sense.examples: It is still my turn. The team had their turn to score. Take your turn already.

sense.name: An unforseen development.
sense.examples: Events suddenly took an awkward turn. The turn of events surprised me.

sense.name: A time for working (after which you will be relieved by someone else.)
sense.examples: Take your turn at the band saw. It's my turn to hoe.

sense.name: A short theatrical program that is part of a longer program.
sense.examples: He did his turn three times every evening. It was one of the best turns he ever did.

sense.name: A favor for someone.
sense.examples: He did me a good turn. He did a turn for me yesterday to aid our cause.

sense.name: Taking a short walk out and back.
sense.examples: We took a turn in the park. He took a turn in the neighborhood.
